result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Copy of bond form faxed to Pathways to a better Life.

Court removes Pretrial Release Monitoring- Drug Monitoring while defendant resides full time and fully participates in an AODA inpatient program. Drug patch should be reapplied immediately upon release from treatment facility. All other conditions remain as previously set.

Cash bond amended to signature bond.
Status conference on November 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Court addresses request to amend bond.   Defense requests cash bond be amended to signature bond. State takes no position.  Court grants request, amends bond to signature bond.  All other conditions remain in effect as previously set.

10:48 AM Defendant Zachary Michael Russell appeared by video from the Door County Jail.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Koenig appeared in court for Zachary Russell.  Atty Shannon Viel will represent pending conflict check. Atty Koenig requests cash bond be amended to signature bond.
Status conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Pretrial Release Monitoring Program: Must be enrolled and equipment activated prior to release - Drug Monitoring. No contact direct or indirect with SIP Coffee Shop it's employees and J.L.B., S.E.E., F.B., their residence or place of employment.

1:22 PM Defendant Zachary Michael Russell appeared by video from the Door County Jail.  Prosecuting attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Shannon Viel in court for Zachary Russell. Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return
